name: Fan Friction: Narrative Strategies for Living Worlds
description: It's common to approach worldbuilding from extremes: either as prescriptive, top-down design of a detailed environment, or as a blank canvas for collaborative creativity. The first perspective undervalues participant input, leading to detailed yet scarcely populated worlds. The second prioritizes participant agency, but risks developing chaotic and incoherent environments. This session aims to steer clear of these extremes, focusing instead on the roles participants play in expanding existing worlds and strategies for inhabiting shared narratives.

speakers.name: Kara Kittel
speakers.bio: Kara Kittel is a creative producer and researcher based in New York. She is a co-founder of Team Rolfes, an experimental 3D animation studio, and Other Internet Research Institute, an in-the-world lab investigating the psychological, political, and economic effects of digitalization. Her current research interests include collaborative authorship and informal coordination practices in online communities.
